intro: Rheedia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered rheedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Rheedia parviflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in warm, humid conditions.
